scenes.name: Introduction to Miguel's Family Curse
scenes.summary: Miguel narrates the history of his family's ban on music, tracing it back to his great-great-grandfather's abandonment.
scenes.firstLine: Sometimes I think I'm cursed... 'cause of something that happened before I was even born.
scenes.lastLine: You see, that woman was my great-great grandmother, Mamá Imelda.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.emotion: Reflective and curious about family history
characters.quote: Sometimes I think I'm cursed... 'cause of something that happened before I was even born.

scenes.name: Miguel's Secret Passion for Music
scenes.summary: Miguel secretly idolizes Ernesto de la Cruz and practices guitar in his hideout.
scenes.firstLine: Miguel reveals a makeshift guitar, cobbled together from a beat up old soundboard and random other items.
scenes.lastLine: Miguel gives a grossed-out chuckle.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: I wish someone wanted to hear me... Other than you...

scenes.name: Confrontation in Mariachi Plaza
scenes.summary: Miguel argues with his family about his secret passion for music after being discovered.
scenes.firstLine: Abuelita! What are you doing here?
scenes.lastLine: My grandson is a sweet little angelito querido cielito -- he wants no part of your music, mariachi! You keep away from him!

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: He was just showing me his guitar...

characters.name: Abuelita
characters.quote: My grandson is a sweet little angelito querido cielito -- he wants no part of your music, mariachi! You keep away from him!

scenes.name: Miguel's Bold Decision
scenes.summary: Miguel decides to seize his moment by entering a music competition despite his family's prohibition.
scenes.firstLine: Look, if you're too scared, then, well... have fun making shoes.
scenes.lastLine: I'm gonna seize my moment!

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: I'm gonna seize my moment!

scenes.name: Miguel's Discovery
scenes.summary: Miguel discovers that his idol, Ernesto de la Cruz, may be his great-great-grandfather and decides to steal his guitar to play in the talent show.
scenes.firstLine: Miguel approaches a statue of a handsome mariachi at the heart of the plaza.
scenes.lastLine: Sometimes, I look at de la Cruz and I get this feeling... like we're connected somehow.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: Sometimes, I look at de la Cruz and I get this feeling... like we're connected somehow.

scenes.name: The Talent Show Plan
scenes.summary: Miguel decides to perform at the Día de Muertos talent show but needs a guitar, prompting him to make a bold choice.
scenes.firstLine: I'm gonna play in Mariachi Plaza if it kills me!
scenes.lastLine: No one's going anywhere. Tonight is about family.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: I'm gonna play in Mariachi Plaza if it kills me!

characters.name: Abuelita
characters.quote: No one's going anywhere. Tonight is about family.

scenes.name: Miguel's Journey to the Land of the Dead
scenes.summary: After stealing de la Cruz's guitar, Miguel finds himself mysteriously transported to the Land of the Dead.
scenes.firstLine: Señor de la Cruz? Please don't be mad. I'm Miguel, your great-great grandson... I need to borrow this.
scenes.lastLine: The guitar! It's gone! Somebody stole de la Cruz's guitar! The window's broken, look.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: Señor de la Cruz? Please don't be mad. I'm Miguel, your great-great grandson... I need to borrow this.

scenes.name: First Encounter in the Land of the Dead
scenes.summary: Miguel meets his ancestors in the Land of the Dead, who are surprised to see him there.
scenes.firstLine: Dante?! You can see me? W-wait! What's going on?!
scenes.lastLine: You're here! HERE here! And you can see us?!

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: Dante?! You can see me? W-wait! What's going on?!

characters.name: Papá Julio
characters.quote: You're here! HERE here! And you can see us?!

scenes.name: Mamá Imelda's Blessing
scenes.summary: Miguel seeks a blessing from Mamá Imelda to return to the living world but with a condition that he must abandon music.
scenes.firstLine: How do we send him back?!
scenes.lastLine: And to never play music again!

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: But I wasn't stealing the guitar!

characters.name: Mamá Imelda
characters.quote: And to never play music again!

scenes.name: Miguel's Escape
scenes.summary: Miguel rejects Mamá Imelda's condition and escapes to find Ernesto de la Cruz to receive his blessing without conditions.
scenes.firstLine: I need to find de la Cruz to get his blessing.
scenes.lastLine: Seize my moment, show me what you got, muchacho.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: I need to find de la Cruz to get his blessing.

scenes.name: Encounter with Héctor
scenes.summary: Miguel meets Héctor, who promises to help him find de la Cruz in exchange for taking his photo back to the Land of the Living.
scenes.firstLine: You know de la Cruz?
scenes.lastLine: Look, if I were you I'd march right up to my family and say, 'Hey! I'm a musician. Deal with it!'

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: You know de la Cruz?

characters.name: Héctor
characters.quote: Look, if I were you I'd march right up to my family and say, 'Hey! I'm a musician. Deal with it!'

scenes.name: Journey Through the Land of the Dead
scenes.summary: Miguel and Héctor traverse the Land of the Dead, encountering various obstacles and learning more about each other.
scenes.firstLine: Did de la Cruz become the world's best musician by hiding his sweet, sweet skills? No! He walked out onto that plaza and he played out loud!
scenes.lastLine: You really hate music that much?

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: You really hate music that much?

characters.name: Héctor
characters.quote: Did de la Cruz become the world's best musician by hiding his sweet, sweet skills? No! He walked out onto that plaza and he played out loud!

scenes.name: The Talent Show at the Land of the Dead
scenes.summary: Miguel performs in a talent show in hopes of meeting Ernesto de la Cruz.
scenes.firstLine: Next up on stage, muchacho from nowhere, he says he's going to shake the heavens!
scenes.lastLine: I did it! I hope de la Cruz was watching!

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: I did it! I hope de la Cruz was watching!

scenes.name: Miguel Meets Ernesto de la Cruz
scenes.summary: Miguel finally meets his idol, Ernesto de la Cruz, and asks for his blessing to return home.
scenes.firstLine: Señor de la Cruz, what did it take for you to seize your moment?
scenes.lastLine: You have spirit, my boy. I will give you my blessing.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: Señor de la Cruz, what did it take for you to seize your moment?

characters.name: Ernesto de la Cruz
characters.quote: You have spirit, my boy. I will give you my blessing.

scenes.name: Truth Revealed
scenes.summary: Miguel learns the shocking truth about Ernesto's past and his real relationship with Héctor.
scenes.firstLine: He's not who we think he is!
scenes.lastLine: I made a mistake. I should have never taken Ernesto's guitar.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: I made a mistake. I should have never taken Ernesto's guitar.

characters.name: Héctor
characters.quote: He's not who we think he is!

scenes.name: Reconciliation and Return
scenes.summary: Miguel is reunited with Héctor, realizes their true family connection, and gains a true understanding of his family history.
scenes.firstLine: You are my real great-great-grandfather!
scenes.lastLine: Let's go home, Miguel. Your family is waiting.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: You are my real great-great-grandfather!

characters.name: Héctor
characters.quote: Let's go home, Miguel. Your family is waiting.

scenes.name: Race Against Time
scenes.summary: Miguel rushes to return to the living world before sunrise to save Héctor's memory and keep his family's story alive.
scenes.firstLine: We have to hurry!
scenes.lastLine: I promise to never forget you, Héctor.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: We have to hurry!

characters.name: Héctor
characters.quote: I promise to never forget you, Héctor.

scenes.name: Miguel's Performance and Family Acceptance
scenes.summary: Miguel plays 'Remember Me' to awaken Mamá Coco's memories, succeeding in preserving Héctor's legacy within the family.
scenes.firstLine: Remember me, though I have to say goodbye.
scenes.lastLine: Ay, Mamá Coco, your papá, he loved you so much.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: Remember me, though I have to say goodbye.

characters.name: Mamá Coco
characters.quote: Ay, Mamá Coco, your papá, he loved you so much.

scenes.name: Mamá Coco Shares Her Memories
scenes.summary: Miguel's song unlocks Mamá Coco's memories, and she shares old artifacts that validate Héctor's legacy.
scenes.firstLine: Now I remember. Your father, he used to sing me that song.
scenes.lastLine: He wrote this song for me. I kept his letters, his poems. Look!

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: She remembers!

characters.name: Mamá Coco
characters.quote: He wrote this song for me. I kept his letters, his poems. Look!

scenes.name: Family Reconciliation
scenes.summary: The Rivera family reconciles their past with music, accepting it back into their lives and honoring Héctor's memory on the ofrenda.
scenes.firstLine: We were wrong about music, and about Héctor.
scenes.lastLine: Let's celebrate our family, our music!

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: Let's celebrate our family, our music!

characters.name: Abuelita
characters.quote: We were wrong about music, and about Héctor.

scenes.name: A New Tradition
scenes.summary: During the next Day of the Dead, Miguel's family celebrates with music, honoring all their ancestors.
scenes.firstLine: Look at our ofrenda, now complete with all our ancestors, including Héctor.
scenes.lastLine: Music brings us together again.

characters.name: Miguel
characters.quote: Music brings us together again.

locations.name: Land of the Dead
locations.quote: Out of the mist, the sparkling cityscape of the Land of the Dead emerges. It's breathtaking.

locations.name: Rivera Household
locations.quote: The Rivera family home, filled with the love, culture, and traditions of generations.

locations.name: Mamá Coco's Room
locations.quote: A quiet room where Mamá Coco spends most of her time, surrounded by memories of the past.

locations.name: Mariachi Plaza
locations.quote: Miguel rounds the corner toward the town square. Vendors sell sugar skulls and marigolds, and musicians fill the square with music.

locations.name: De la Cruz's Mausoleum
locations.quote: Inside, the famous guitar hangs above the crypt. Fireworks pop; bursts of light glint off the instrument.

locations.name: Marigold Grand Central Station
locations.quote: Welcome back to the Land of the Dead. Please have all offerings ready for re-entry.

locations.name: Marigold Path
locations.quote: A path of marigold petals leads up to an altar lovingly arranged in a humble cemetery.

characters.quote: Sometimes I think I'm cursed... 'cause of something that happened before I was even born.
characters.explanation: A vibrant orange, symbolizing Miguel's youthful energy and passion for music, despite the 'cursed' feeling.

characters.quote: Music had torn her family apart, but shoes held them all together.
characters.explanation: A deep mauve, representing her serious and strong-willed nature that binds the family.

characters.quote: She's my great grandmother, Mamá Coco.
characters.explanation: A light beige, reflecting her aged wisdom and the warmth she holds within the family.

characters.quote: Abuelita runs our house just like Mamá Imelda did.
characters.explanation: A rich sienna, denoting her traditional values and strong matriarchal role.

characters.quote: Never underestimate the power of music...
characters.explanation: A lively green, capturing his lively spirit and the rejuvenation his music brings.

characters.quote: The greatest musician of all time.
characters.explanation: A dramatic crimson, highlighting his fame and the darker secrets he holds.

characters.quote: You're here! HERE here! And you can see us?!
characters.explanation: A soft blue, symbolizing his gentle and welcoming nature in the afterlife.
